Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown ribbed pottery vessel, interior covered with traces of a brown resinous substance, with remains of eight lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior, worn and faded in places, containing an account of corn.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.120)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87628) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87628)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 138 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
